title: Solution Architect
company_industry: Information Technology & Services, IT System Custom Software Development, and Software Development
description:
Company: US3 Consulting
 



 About Company: US3 Consulting is a leading European IT recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top tech talent with innovative companies across the continent. With decades of experience and a fresh approach, we specialize in rapid, cost-effective candidate sourcing across all tech industry sectors. Our expert consultants are committed to building strong, productive relationships, ensuring the perfect fit between candidates and employers.
 



  





 Job Title: Solution Architect
 



 Total Experience Required: 10+ years in Information Technology/Computers/Software
 



 Relevant Experience Required: 8+ years in designing and implementing enterprise integration and messaging solutions within complex IT environments.
 



 Contract Duration: A minimum duration of 6 months, with the possibility of extension up to 18 months or beyond, depending on project requirements.
 



 Workplace Type: Hybrid (at least 3 times a week at office)
 



 Languages Required: English
 



 Visa/Work Authorization Status: Candidates must hold a valid work permit or visa to work in Sweden
 



 Work Location: Stockholm, Sweden
 


1. Must be currently based in Sweden or
2. Willing to relocate to Sweden from anywhere within Europe or the UK
3. Candidates outside Europe/UK unfortunately cannot be considered



  





 About Client: Client offers a dynamic environment where innovation and professional growth are at the forefront. With a strong emphasis on continuous learning, the company provides employees access to extensive training programs, including LinkedIn Learning and an Education Assistance Program.
 



  





 The company champions a balanced work-life culture, promoting flexible work hours and a supportive atmosphere that values diversity and inclusion. As a part of the esteemed group, it combines global opportunities with a commitment to employee well-being, making it an ideal workplace for those seeking both professional excellence and personal fulfillment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Drive the architectural design for MQ distributed to Kafka integration.
* Contribute to architecture initiatives related to Sterling (file transfer), Kafka cloud multiregional, and API platforms.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure architectural alignment with enterprise standards.
* Provide technical leadership and guidance to development and integration teams.
* Evaluate emerging technologies to enhance integration efficiency and reliability.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Strong expertise in Middleware technologies including MQ, Message Broker, Sterling, and Batch processing.
* Proven experience with Queue technologies (MQ) and integration platforms.
* Solid background in Mainframe systems and DB2 application development.
* Hands-on experience with IBM Sterling Commerce OMS.



  





**Optional Skills:** 



* Exposure to cloud-native Kafka architecture and multi-regional deployments.
* Familiarity with modern API management and integration strategies.



  





 Interested? Apply Now!
 



 📧 Send your resume to: sowmya@us3consulting.nl
 







 🔁 Not a fit for you? Share this with someone in your network who might be interested!
 



 🔗 Connect: linkedin.com/in/sowmyakotamarthy
 



 🌐 Visit our homepage: https://www.us3consulting.co.uk
 



 🔗 Follow us on LinkedIn for more exciting opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/company/us3-consulting
 



  





 #SolutionArchitect #Kafka #IBM Sterling #Middleware #MessageBroker #MQ #IntegrationArchitecture #Mainframe #DB2 #APIIntegration #StockholmJobs #ContractRole #EnterpriseArchitecture

title: Executive Assistant, Amazon Web Services, Northern Europe
description:
**Description**
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking a proactive, customer obsessed and team oriented Executive Assistant to support the Managing Director and the Technical Director of AWS Europe North. This role requires attention to detail, organizational skills, and the ability to meet tight deadlines. The candidate will be comfortable in a fast-paced, fluid environment, while maintaining great flexibility, a sense of humor and composure. The candidate will work autonomously on many projects as required and possess the ability to complete a high volume of tasks with minimal guidance or supervision.
   

  

 Amazon EAs are the primary point of contact and information flow to and from a variety of teams, clients and partners to our senior leaders - we seek to hire and then offer continual development to the very best EAs ready to work in our fast paced, customer focused organization.
   

  

 We are looking for bright and motivated candidates with experience of supporting multiple executives and who can demonstrate expertise with complex diary management, travel arrangements and expense recording as well as the set-up, budgeting and active management of small to mid-scale events for their teams.
   

  

 Superior attention to detail and the ability to meet tight deadlines and juggle multiple requests is critical. Integrity and discretion in handling confidential information and professionalism in dealing with senior executives is imperative. A flexible approach is a must, and the ability to change direction at a moment’s notice.
   

  

 As a community, the EAs work together to deliver large scale events and to share workload when priorities demand additional support - commitment to teamwork is essential.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience with reconciling expenses
* Substantial experience assisting at the executive level in a fast-paced environment
* Highly proficient with Microsoft Office, specifically Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Experience coordinating and communicating using tools like Slack
* Experience with domestic and international travel coordination


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Senior experience assisting at the executive level
* Ability to quickly learn organizational structures, team objectives and adopt Amazon values and vision
* Ability to handle administrative details independently while exercising good judgment in keeping team members adequately informed
* Creative approach to problem solving and event planning
* Ability to handle confidential information with discretion, and deal with professionals inside and outside the company
* Ability to work in a highly ambiguous and changing environment with composure


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Supply Chain Team Lead
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Retail, and Retail Apparel and Fashion
description:
Tata consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





 We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.
 



  





**Role: Supply Chain Process Lead** 




**Experience (Years): 15+ Years** 




  




* Business Process Lead with Strong process knowledge and experience in planning & conducting process workshops and do FIT/GAP analysis in Supply Chain
* Minimum of 15+ years of experience in SAP Retail – Supply chain logistics processes (Procure to Pay, Order to cash for both retail and eCommerce flows)
* S/4 HANA Implementation experience is required
* Hand-On with Process modelling tools Signavio preferred, other process modelling tools
* Experience on
* Represent in Process Board & Solution Design authority board on critical Process GAPs / Architecture solution review and decision documentation.
* Ensure Fit to Standard and govern clean core principles with technical architects
* Business process design documentation and coordinate with Process owners for review & ensure Sign-off
* Strong Knowledge on Procure to Pay & Order to cash processes – Inventory management, Handling Units management, Inbound & Outbound delivery, advanced ATP in S/4, Goods receipt & Goods issue processes, Standard EDI Integrations, Cross Dock and Flow through merchandise processes are required
* Knowledge on integrated processes with replenishment and allocation solutions, SAP EWM & 3rd Party WMS systems Integrations, Transport Management Integrations
* Global retailer with eCommerce presence, knowledge of eCommerce sales flow with ATP reservations & omni channel availability solution is required
* Experience / Capability knowledge on SAP EWM and any Transport Solutions & GTS trade services process exposure is preferred
* Work with Business and Change management lead to draw out Change Impacts list
* Understanding of LTMC and Data Migration capabilities to coordinate with data management team
* Understanding of role-based process design and Fiori role design coordination with Roles & Authorization team is required
* Hands on experience on Configuration in system is an advantage
* Functional design ownership on solution fitment meets process design and business requirement
* Good communication skills, problem solving mindset and cross functional coordination skills required



  





**Good-To-Have:** 



* Strong implementation Experience in SAP S/4 SCM.
* Knowledge in Retail business



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **pallavi.malhotra@tcs.com**

title: Engagement Associate
description:
**About Sana**
 We're on a mission to revolutionize how humans access knowledge through artificial intelligence. Throughout history, breakthroughs in knowledge sharing—from the Library of Alexandria to the printing press to Google—have been pivotal drivers of human progress. Today, as the volume of human knowledge grows exponentially, making it accessible and actionable remains one of humanity's most critical challenges. We're building a future where knowledge isn't just more accessible—it's a catalyst for achieving the previously impossible.
   

  

 If all of this sounds exciting, you’re in the right place.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We believe that everything starts with learning. And that by changing the way the world learns, we can change the world for the better. If that’s a mission that excites you, you’ll be in great company at Sana. Join our Stockholm team as an Engagement Associate and work alongside a team of highly motivated people from previous workplaces such as Google AI, Spotify, BCG, and McKinsey. Our Impact team is known for its adaptability, entrepreneurial spirit, and relentless pursuit of excellence, embodying our core belief that learning is the foundation of all meaningful change.
   

  

 In the Impact team, we work very closely with the companies who choose Sana. Together we problem solve, design solutions and implement them to drive change. Ultimately we measure ourselves through the impact we achieve through rolling out and adopting Sana. Our challenges are to continually learn and adapt to meet the unique needs of each company and team, and implement the creative solutions that make us proud of what we have achieved. While doing so we define what the future Sana's customer success, solution engineering and deployments teams will look like. By scaling this team, we create a significant impact on how people learn, across every industry, and across the globe.
   

  

**What Will Help You Thrive**
* Are naturally curious, always seeking to learn, and view every challenge as a growth opportunity.
* Possess grit and determination, allowing you to weather setbacks and persist towards your goals.
* Are driven by excellence, striving for greatness in everything you do.
* Embody humbleness, always ready to learn from others and unafraid to admit when you're wrong.
* Are deeply committed to our mission of changing the way the world learns, and have a genuine passion for global business development.
* Possess an entrepreneurial spirit, with the mindset of a founder and the readiness to build our customer success team.
* Are impact-driven, motivated to make a difference and continuously push the limits of what's possible.


****What we offer****
* Help shape AI's future alongside brilliant minds from Notion, Dropbox, Slack, Databricks, Google, McKinsey, and BCG.
* Competitive salary complemented with a transparent and highly competitive options program.
* Swift professional growth in an evolving environment, supported by a culture of continuous feedback and mentorship from senior leaders.
* Work with talented teammates across 5+ countries, and collaborate with customers globally
* Regular team gatherings and events (recently in Italy and South Africa)

title: IT Architect - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for IT Architects who will collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on local and international client projects! We develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying our technical know-how, experience in IT projects, and analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* have a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, engineering, or a related field
* have approx. two years of relevant experience in IT consulting or software development (part or full time)
* know that modern tools such as machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile methods, AI, and robotics aren't just buzzwords, but essential to sustainable IT architectures
* have broad technical expertise and interest in technology trends
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Shape the digital transformation of globally leading companies, ensuring their success by evaluating their capabilities and performing feasibility studies
* Manage small, agile development teams in strategic IT implementation programs, establish modern practices like DevOps and CI/CD, and be in charge of the technical implementation of crucial digital requirements such as cyber resilience
* Analyze, develop, and optimize cutting-edge, customized IT architectures while applying your comprehensive understanding of legacy IT, enterprise solutions, and current market developments and trends such as cloud computing and microservices


 Additional info
   

  

**How You Can Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: IT-samordnare
description:
Vill du arbeta i en samhällsviktig verksamhet där din kompetens inom IT gör verklig skillnad? Som IT-samordnare hos Norrvatten får du en central roll i att säkerställa driftsäkra IT-lösningar som stödjer verksamhetens långsiktiga utveckling och behov. Är du den vi söker?
 



  





**Ditt uppdrag** 




 Rollen innebär bland annat att:
 


* Säkerställa en stabil och säker drift av organisationens IT-system i nära samarbete med våra driftpartner.
* Förvalta och vidareutveckla befintliga system och lösningar.
* Vara beställare gentemot externa leverantörer och följa upp att avtal, tjänster och leveranser motsvarar verksamhetens behov.
* Ansvara för telekommunikationslösningar och tillhandahålla IT- och telefonilösningar för våra kontorsplatser.
* Genomföra inköp och upphandlingar av hårdvara, mjukvara och drifttjänster.
* Ge stöd till verksamheten i frågor som rör IT-användning, system och utrustning.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad och bidra med nya lösningar IT-lösningar för att möta framtida behov.
* Tillsammans med vår säkerhetschef säkerställa att IT-miljön uppfyller lagkrav och standarder inom exempelvis informationssäkerhet.
* Bidra till det strategiska IT-arbetet genom att omsätta verksamhetens mål till en långsiktig IT-strategi och utvecklingsplan.



  





  





 Du kommer att vara placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Sundbyberg. Tjänsten innebär att regelbundet kommer att arbeta vid vårt vattenverk Görvälnverket i Järfälla.
 



  





  





**Kvalifikationer** 



* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av IT-system.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning och upphandling och följa upp externa leverantörer/entreprenörer inom IT-drift.
* Erfarenhet av att ansvara för telekommunikationslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av strategiskt IT-arbete
* B-körkort
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Meriterande kunskaper** 



* Erfarenhet av att driva IT-utvecklingsprojekt och effektivisera IT-processer, till exempel genom automatisering eller digitalisering.
* Erfarenhet från att jobba i en liknande organisation eller offentlig verksamhet.
* Erfarenhet av att utbilda och stödja personal i användning av IT-system och digitala verktyg.



  





  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 För att trivas i rollen är du strukturerad och noggrann. Du kan planera och prioritera ditt arbete och är van att arbeta självständigt. Du är tydlig i din kommunikation och kan förklara teknik på ett sätt som andra förstår. Du samarbetar gärna, både med kollegor och externa leverantörer.
 



  





  





**Norrvattens erbjudande** 




 Vi erbjuder ett arbete med en hög grad av påverkan i en kunskapsintensiv organisation med stort engagemang och stolthet över vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag. På Norrvatten arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en öppen och inkluderande organisation där medarbetare trivs, mår bra och bidrar till helheten.
 



  





 Vi ligger i teknikens framkant och driver utveckling av dricksvattenförsörjningen i samarbete med våra medlemskommuner och andra vatten- och miljöaktörer.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder flera förmåner för dig som är anställd hos Norrvatten som till exempel friskvårdsbidrag och lunchförmån. Alla medarbetare omfattas av kollektivavtal genom arbetsgivarorganisationen Sobona.
 



  





  





**Om Norrvatten** 




 Norrvatten producerar dricksvatten till 14 kommuner i norra Storstockholm. Omkring
 



 700 000 människor, flera stora sjukhus samt Arlanda flygplats är beroende av att Norrvatten varje dag, dygnet runt levererar ett hälsosamt dricksvatten.
 



  





 Norrvatten är Sveriges fjärde största dricksvattenproducent. Ungefär 90 personer arbetar hos oss. Huvudkontoret ligger i Sundbyberg. Vårt vattenverk, Görvälnverket, ligger i Järfälla kommun, och är en av Sveriges vackrast belägna arbetsplatser med närhet till Mälaren och en fantastisk natur. Här producerar vi 1600 liter dricksvatten per sekund.
 



  





  





**Ansökan och mer information** 




 Anställning inom Norrvatten innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för anställning är godkänt resultat i säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll, som genomförs i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
 



 Norrvatten använder TeamTailor för att hantera jobbansökningar. Du söker jobbet genom ett webbformulär.
 



  





 Upplysningar om tjänsten lämnas av Alberto Craizer , Enhetschef IT och säkerhet som nås via 08-627 37 18 eller alberto.craizer@norrvatten.se
 



  





 Fackliga representanter är Olli Sammalisto och Annika Palmgren (SACO) samt Frej Eklind och Tomas Wahlund (Vision). Dessa nås via Norrvattens växel: 08-627 37 00.
 



  





 Låter tjänsten intressant så skicka in din ansökan snarast, dock senast 2025-11-17. Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske i löpande under ansökningsperioden. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.

title: Product Manager
description:
At Bonava, we are not only building houses – we are creating homes and neighbourhoods where people live their lives. We are now looking for a Product Manager to take on a brand-new role shaping the strategy for Bonava’s most critical financial systems and platforms. In this role, you will bridge finance and technology to enable smarter decisions, stronger collaboration and long-term success. This is a unique opportunity to make an impact in a company and an industry undergoing exciting transformation.
   

  

**About The Job**
 This newly created position sits within the Finance organization and has been established to ensure a holistic perspective across Bonava’s core financial systems and platforms. We are looking for someone who can connect the dots, set the direction and lead the way forward across Bonava’s digital landscape.
   

  

 As Product Manager, you will guide a team of specialists and drive the strategic roadmap for our core systems. You’ll work closely with Finance, IT and Operations to ensure our platforms enable Bonava’s business goals. While not expected to be a deep technical expert, you should be comfortable navigating system concepts, understanding financial processes and translating business needs into actionable solutions. Excellent communication skills and strong stakeholder management are essential to succeed in this role.
   

  

**Key** 
**responsibilities**
* Define and drive the strategic roadmap for Bonava’s key platforms (ERP, project management, business planning tools)
* Lead and coach a team of system specialists
* Ensure a holistic view across systems and processes, aligning them with Bonava’s business goals
* Drive change management and increase adoption of our planning and reporting tools
* Translate business needs into effective technical solutions, collaborating across Finance, IT and Operations
* Build trust-based relationships and engage stakeholders at all levels


 ,
   

  

**What** 
 w
 **e are looking for**
* 8+ years of experience in senior roles within system, finance, or IT, for example Product Manager, Application Manager, Project Manager or Consultant
* Proven success in ERP or major system implementations, including process mapping, change management and cross-functional collaboration
* Strong understanding of financial processes and conceptual grasp of core business platforms
* Demonstrated ability to drive change with excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Strong business acumen and strategic mindset
* Fluent in English (Swedish or other languages are a plus)


 You are a visionary leader who combines clear direction with active listening and collaboration. You inspire trust, alignment and engagement across teams and thrive when leading transformation in complex environments.
   

  

**Join our Journey**
 When you apply, please submit your resume and cover letter in English. We are reviewing applications continuously, so please send your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions, please reach out to Caroline.kylbergh@bonava.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 /
   

  

**About Bonava**
*Bonava is a leading residential developer in Europe with the purpose to create happy neighbourhoods for the many. With its 900 employees, Bonava develops residential housing in Germany, Sweden, Finland, Latvia, Estonia and Lithuania. To date, the company has built about 40,000 homes and reported net sales of approximately SEK 8 Bn in 2024. Bonava’s shares and green bond are listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.*

title: Integration Architect
description:
**For a Sustainable Future Together**
 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
   

  

**At Coop, We Live Our Values Every Day**
* Welcoming: We are inclusive, interested, and considerate in our work to create a positive and supportive work environment.
* Inspiring: We are generous and innovative, passionate about always doing our best for our members.
* Brave: We stand up for what we believe in, are transparent, and dare to lead change.
* Responsible: We deliver on our promises and take responsibility for future generations, both in the workplace and in society.


 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
   

  

**Join Coop – Together, we make Sweden's food landscape sustainable!**
**About The Position**
 We are seeking an experienced Integration Architect to join our IT Integration Team, which is responsible for designing, developing, and supporting integration solutions across the entire organization. In this role, you will play a key part in connecting enterprise applications, and ensuring our integration landscape is secure, scalable, and aligned with our business strategy.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* Design and implement integrations between enterprise applications, including ERP platforms such as SAP S/4HANA.
* Collaborate with architects, application owners, and business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective integration solutions.
* Ensure technical excellence and consistency through peer reviews, automation, and the definition of development standards and guidelines.
* Evaluate emerging technologies, conduct proofs of concept, and recommend improvements to enhance the integration landscape.
* Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and guidance to develop and support teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.


***Who are you?***
 You are an experienced Integration Architect with both technical depth and strategic understanding. You have a genuine interest in how technology enables business and thrive in the space between architecture and execution.
   

  

 You enjoy working collaboratively, guiding others, exchanging ideas, and contributing to a culture where expertise is shared openly. You have the confidence to challenge existing solutions and the curiosity to explore new ones.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience, including at least 5 years focused on Microsoft Azure architecture and integration design.
* Proven expertise in Azure services such as Function Apps, API Management, Event Grid, Storage, App Services, and Entra ID.
* Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (Azure DevOps, GitHub), and agile delivery methodologies.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, PowerShell, or Python.
* Sound understanding of cloud security, networking principles, and performance optimization.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with SAP S/4HANA integrations, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and code quality tools (e.g., SonarQube) is considered an advantage.


 Fluency in both spoken and written English is required, while proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 We offer you a workplace where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop in an inclusive and inspiring culture. At Coop, you will be part of a dedicated, innovative and skille integration team and contribute to a more sustainable future. We also offer competitive benefits, flexible working hours, and a healthy work–life balance.
   

  

 We work in a hybrid model where you’ll spend around three days per week at our Solna headquarters.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Integration Tech Lead Amit Kumar Gupta (amitkumar.gupta@coop.se).
   

  

 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst ha 6 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete som utvecklare på IT-avdelningar. Erfarenheten ska ha införskaffats under de senaste 10 åren
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete som utvecklare på IT-avdelningar där minst 1 av uppdragen ska ha pågått under minst 2 år. Erfarenheten ska ha införskaffats under de senaste 6 åren.
* Minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av CI/CD.
* Minst 5 års praktisk erfarenhet av att jobba i språket Java.
* Minst 3 års praktisk av att jobba med microtjänster.
* Minst 3 års praktisk av att jobba med OpenShift.
* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet av att utveckla automatiserade tester.
* Minst 4 års praktisk erfarenhet av utveckling i ett agilt arbetssätt
* God förmåga att uttrycka sig i tal och skrift på svenska.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 17-10-2025
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Field Software Support Specialist
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
At
 **Elekta** 
 , we are united by a clear purpose:
 **to improve, prolong and save lives** 
 . Our advanced oncology and radiotherapy software solutions are used globally to treat cancer and brain disorders. Now, we’re looking for a
 **Field Software Support Specialist** 
 to join our high-performing team – someone who thrives in dynamic environments and is passionate about supporting technology that truly matters.
   

  

 As a
 **Field Software Support Specialist** 
 , you will serve as the central point of contact for service-related matters concerning Elekta software and third-party integrations within your region. You’ll manage and resolve technical issues in complex clinical IT environments, deliver first-level training, and ensure outstanding customer satisfaction through proactive and responsive support.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
* Act as the primary contact for customers on all service-related software issues.
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in Windows Server and SQL-based environments (remote & on-site)
* Proactively monitor systems and perform preventative support.
* Handle technical inquiries via phone and manage prioritization and planning of service tasks.
* Document incidents, actions, and resolutions per Elekta and local compliance standards.
* Communicate clearly with both internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Escalate complex issues and ensure timely resolution
* Provide first-level software training to local hardware service teams.
* Champion customer satisfaction and propose improvements
* Maintain ongoing dialogue with Sales and Service Management regarding customer insights.


**What You Bring**
* Completed studies in a field of information technology or similar engineering sciences.
* Experience with troubleshooting Windows client and server operating systems, virtualization and remote access tools, Citrix, networking configuration, troubleshooting, and Microsoft SQL installation/configuration is essential.
* Experience in medical imaging, linear accelerators and/or clinical use of radiotherapy products is desirable.
* Experience in a support environment is desirable.
* Excellent knowledge of local language and good knowledge of English, both written and spoken.
* Strong analytical skills with an excellent feel for dynamically changing situations and priorities.
* Interest and curiosity in acquiring knowledge independently.
* Strong communication skills and enjoy interacting with people.
* High degree of self-organization, ability to work in a team and personal responsibility
* Exceptional self-motivation and flexibility.
* Able to travel up to 20% in the assigned territory.


**We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every requirement—your unique skills and experiences might be exactly what we're looking for!**
**Why should you join Elekta?**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. You will be part of our international innovative team and given the opportunity to learn and develop.
   

  

**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact the responsible Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Nidhi Pousette, nidhi.pousette@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.
   

  

**About Elekta**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are a MedTech company that provides software and hardware to hospitals and clinics all over the world.
   

  

 We have a responsibility toward our partners and customers to deliver solutions in a secure and sustainable way. Both when it comes to financial and environmental matters, but also for our employees to feel that they bring value, wherever in the organization they may work

title: Sales Manager
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Computer Hardware Manufacturing, and Computer and Network Security
description:
**Sales Manager – Nordics** 




  





**Location:** 
 Nordics Region
 



**Reports to:** 
 General Manager – Nordics
 



  





**Overview** 




 A leading international technology distribution group is seeking a
 **Sales Manager** 
 to oversee its Nordics sales operations. The organisation partners with global technology brands, providing enterprise, infrastructure, component, and security solutions across Europe.
 



 You will lead a small sales team, manage key accounts, and work closely with vendors and channel partners to drive revenue growth, expand product coverage, and strengthen market presence across the region.
 



 This is a strategic leadership role within a high-performing, growth-focused environment.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




**Sales Leadership & Team Management** 



* Lead and develop a regional sales team to achieve revenue and margin targets.
* Introduce and manage KPIs and performance metrics to identify and capitalise on sales opportunities.
* Foster a results-driven culture that promotes accountability and continuous improvement.



  





**Planning & Execution** 



* Build and implement targeted business plans for key customer accounts.
* Drive data-led sales activity using internal reports, analytics, and market insights.
* Plan and execute local sales campaigns, product pushes, and vendor initiatives.



  





**Operational Excellence** 



* Ensure compliance with all legal, ethical, and corporate standards.
* Promote best practice in pipeline management, forecasting, and business planning.
* Collaborate with commercial and pre-sales teams to ensure a strong understanding of the product portfolio.



  





**Skills & Experience** 



* Proven experience in IT channel sales or distribution (preferably in enterprise, infrastructure, or components).
* Strong track record in managing and motivating a sales team.
* Skilled in sales planning, analysis, and execution.
* Ability to understand and simplify technical product offerings for resellers and partners.
* Experience working within profit-focused, target-driven environments.



  





**Culture & Values** 




 We are a results-driven organisation that recognises people as the key to success. We set ambitious goals but also prioritise collaboration, inclusion, and enjoyment in the workplace.
 



 We welcome diverse perspectives and encourage open discussion about flexible working or other needs that could make this role work best for you.

title: Implementation Specialist
description:
Intric is accelerating its growth, driven by a fresh round of funding from investors and strong demand from both existing and new customers.
   

  

 Our platform - Intric.ai - is currently transforming how work is done, primarily within the public sector and companies valuing data sovereignty, by making the power of AI accessible to a wider audience. We have secured a market-leading position in a niche of this segment.
   

  

 We are seeking a motivated individual eager to embark on the journey of a lifetime with our expanding and driven team.
   

  

**Your role**
 As an Implementation Specialist, you will be at the forefront of ensuring our customers make the most of our innovative platform. Your role is not just about understanding our customers and their needs but also about communicating how our platform can enhance these processes. You'll be key in engaging, educating, and inspiring users to fully leverage our technology.
   

  

**Who You Are**
* Socially and educationally adept. You excel in communicating ideas and concepts simply and persuasively, helping users understand and embrace our platform's potential.
* Service-oriented. With a positive, pedagogical approach, you ignite enthusiasm in customers, guiding them through their projects and inspiring further applications of our platform.
* Technologically savvy. You are a quick learner when it comes to using technology, and usually catch on to new systems and ways of working quickly.
* Perceptive and curious. You are interested in our customers businesses, and quickly understand new processes and workflows. You will be collaborating with experts in their fields to extract essential information leading to the most value creating implementation.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Engaging and educating. Communicate the value and functionality of our platform effectively to users, ensuring they are not just informed but inspired.
* Facilitating integration. Leverage your understanding of the capabilities of AI and our platform, in order to help organizations seamlessly integrate it into their day.
* Cultivating enthusiasm. Create excitement around projects, motivating users to explore new applications of our platform.
* Process Analysis. Deeply understand diverse business processes to identify and implement efficiency opportunities.


**What We Offer**
* An opportunity to be a part of building a system and company that defines the future
* Rapid career development in an exciting, fast-moving sector
* Competitive compensation package combining salary and stock options


 If you thrive on educating and inspiring others, and you're ready to make a significant impact with our growing company, we would love to hear from you!

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**About Legora**
 Legora is the world’s first truly collaborative AI for lawyers. The platform is embedded in thousands of lawyers’ everyday life in nearly 20 countries by over 250 clients, helping them work more efficiently, accurately, and focus on high-impact, strategic work.
   

  

 With offices in New York, London and Stockholm, we are on a mission to empower exceptional lawyers by unleashing their expertise. Our team of product builders and lawyers ship fast and innovate - with our users and clients.
   

  

 But we are not stopping here, new features, new territories and most importantly; New clients. That is hopefully where you come in.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The way legal work gets done is changing - and Customer Success is at the heart of that transformation. We’re looking for an experienced, thoughtful Customer Success Manager with a demonstrated commercial record to join our growing team in Stockholm and help drive how the world’s top law firms adopt, scale, and succeed with Legora.
   

  

 This is a hands-on role for someone who knows how to build deep client relationships, deliver real value fast, and act as a trusted advisor throughout the customer journey, while being comfortable owning/leading commercial conversations. You’ll work closely with new and existing clients to ensure they are onboarded smoothly, supported effectively, and continually discovering new ways to unlock value with next generation of AI and our platform.
   

  

 You’ll also be a founding pillar in a critical function, helping shape how we scale Customer Success at Legora from the ground up.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You’ll be the face of Legora for our clients post-sale - guiding them from onboarding through adoption, expansion, and renewal. Specifically, you will:
   

  

* Own the customer journey for a growing book of highly intellectual clients - leading law firms and legal teams across Europe and beyond.
* Lead onboarding and implementation, ensuring clients are set up for success from day one.
* Proactively drive product adoption and usage through structured enablement, regular check-ins, and tailored success plans.
* Act as a strategic advisor: understanding client goals, uncovering new use cases, and helping teams realize maximum value.
* Identify expansion opportunities and then own the commercial negotiation, taking responsibility for renewals and upsells.
* Monitor customer health metrics and take initiative to reduce churn risk and drive retention.
* Closely collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Marketing to translate client feedback into actionable insights.
* Help build and refine our Customer Success playbook - we’re building this machine together. We are just getting started on this and your input will not only be appreciated but expected.


**What You Bring**
 You care deeply about customer outcomes - and you know that successful adoption doesn’t just happen. You’re proactive, strategic, and deeply comfortable working with demanding clients. You take pride in being the reason customers stay, grow, and succeed.
   

  

**We’re Looking For**
* 5–7 years of Customer Success, Account Management, or related experience in a high-growth B2B SaaS environment. Account Executives with experience owning full sales cycles will also be considered.
* A track record of driving customer retention, expansion, and satisfaction.
* A hunter mentality. Someone who is comfortable going out, finding and closing commercial opportunities.
* Experience working with legal, compliance, or other regulated/complex industries and clients - or just ridiculously good at learning as you go.
* Strong project management and onboarding experience; you keep things moving and your clients confident.
* Excellent communication skills; written, verbal, and interpersonal. You can manage high-level conversations with legal leaders and roll up your sleeves with hands-on teams.
* High EQ and commercial instinct, meaning you know when to listen, when to advise, and when to act.
* A love of fast-paced, early-stage environments where you help build the playbook, not just follow it.
* Comfortable with metrics - driven by data, customer health, and outcomes over process.
* Someone who enjoys being in the office 5 days a week. A key component of Legora’s success has been in-person collaboration and we want you to be part of that.


**What We Offer**
 At Legora, you’ll have the chance to build long-term, strategic relationships with some of the world’s leading law firms - working on truly impactful problems from day one. You’ll be part of a fast-scaling, entrepreneurial environment where your ideas matter and your growth is a priority. As an early member of the Customer Success team, your work will be visible, meaningful, and closely connected to both our clients and our product evolution. You’ll collaborate with senior leadership and cross-functional teams, helping shape not just customer outcomes but how we engage and support legal professionals across the globe. We offer a competitive salary, a high-upside equity program, and full support for relocation to our centrally located Stockholm office - designed for focus, energy, and great collaboration.
   

  

 We founded Legora to empower lawyers with the tools they truly deserve. We’re not building for the way law is practiced today - we’re reimagining how it will be practiced tomorrow.

title: Senior Business Development Manager - Healthcare and Life Sciences
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Commercial discipline is responsible for driving business growth, managing partnerships, and providing industry subject matter expertise and advisory to both clients and internal teams. This strategic and consultative team creates meaningful relationships with clients through their combined knowledge of IT services and industry trends and pain points. Members include business development staff of all levels, client partners, alliances and partnerships managers, industry advisors, and operational leads.
   

  

 As a Senior Business Development Manager at Endava, you will identify new clients, and introduce them to our capabilities and IT services. You'll guide these new customers through the entire sales cycle, offering solutions that allow them to achieve business goals through enterprise transformation of their IT environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Act as a trusted advisor, selling IT Professional Services and building long-term client relationships.
* Generate and qualify leads through outreach, networking, and research to maintain a strong sales pipeline.
* Manage the full sales cycle from prospecting to closing, with a focus on strategic, high-value deals.
* Leverage deep industry knowledge to position yourself as a Subject Matter Expert and drive revenue growth.
* Engage in industry events and thought leadership opportunities, while benefiting from an aggressive commission model.


**Qualifications**
* 8-10+ years of new business development experience focused on selling IT solutions to solve customer's business challenges
* Significant experience and network within one or more of the Provider, Medical Devices, or Biotech & Pharma industries, with a strong understanding of the industry trends and challenges
* Experience leading strategic new business development initiatives to uncover opportunities with large enterprise clients.
* Sales-driven professional with hunter-centric sales experience including prospecting, cold calling, qualifying leads, conducting sales presentations, negotiating, closing contracts, and building relationships.
* Demonstrated track record of success in new business development, achieving £5M+ quota in first year and larger (£20M+) in subsequent years.


 Additional Requirements:
   

  

  

* Travel is an integral part of a this role and the individual will need to travel locally, within country, and internationally as needed to perform the role (they should have a valid passport/driving license and be prepared to travel during working hours as needed by the company).
* Work-related tradeshows or live events may require the individual to occasionally lift 25 pounds.


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Senior Solutions Consultant - FP&A
description:
At Anaplan, we are a team of innovators focused on optimizing business decision-making through our leading AI-infused scenario planning and analysis platform so our customers can outpace their competition and the market.
   

  

 What unites Anaplanners across teams and geographies is our collective commitment to our customers’ success and to our Winning Culture.
   

  

 Our customers rank among the who’s who in the Fortune 50. Coca-Cola, LinkedIn, Adobe, LVMH and Bayer are just a few of the 2,400+ global companies who rely on our best-in-class platform.
   

  

 Our Winning Culture is the engine that drives our teams of innovators. We champion diversity of thought and ideas, we behave like leaders regardless of title, we are committed to achieving ambitious goals, and we love celebrating our wins – big and small.
   

  

 Supported by operating principles of being strategy-led, values-based and disciplined in execution, you’ll be inspired, connected, developed and rewarded here. Everything that makes you unique is welcome; join us and let’s build what’s next - together!
   

  

**Presales Solution Consultant – FP&A – Anaplan** 
 - Stockholm -
 **Hybrid**
**Shape the Future of Financial Strategy at the Enterprise Level.**
 At
 **Anaplan** 
 , we don’t just power planning—we transform it. As a
 **Solution Consultant specialising in FP&A** 
 , you’ll sit at the intersection of technology, strategy, and finance, helping some of the world’s most influential organisations reshape how they run their businesses.
   

  

 In today’s enterprise landscape,
 **FP&A isn’t just about reporting numbers** 
 —it’s about driving smarter, faster, more connected decisions. At Anaplan, you’ll be at the forefront of that shift, enabling finance leaders to replace outdated spreadsheets and disconnected systems with agile, predictive, and collaborative planning solutions.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
* FP&A is evolving fast. Business leaders are no longer looking for just cost control—they need forecasting agility, cross-functional alignment, and real-time insights. You’ll help them get there.
* You’ll work with strategic decision-makers at leading enterprise organisations, influencing outcomes that impact thousands of employees and billions in revenue.
* You’ll represent one of the fastest-growing cloud platforms in the world, with a commission structure and career path to match your ambition.


**Why Anaplan?**
* Work with some of the biggest brands in the world on high-impact transformation projects.
* Thrive in a supportive, fast-paced, high-growth environment where your expertise is valued.
* Benefit from a generous commission plan, hybrid flexibility, and a global team that’s redefining what’s possible in planning.


**Your Impact**
* Engaging with C-suite and senior finance leaders to uncover and challenge broken planning processes.
* Articulating Anaplan’s unique value proposition in transforming how organisations forecast, budget, and model complex business scenarios.
* Delivering tailored demos and designing proof-of-concept models that directly align with customer pain points and goals.
* Collaborating with Sales, Customer Success, and Product teams to influence deal strategy, product direction and drive long-term value.
* Navigating large, complex enterprises to build trust, manage stakeholders, and deliver value-driven outcomes.
* Evangelising best practices and thought leadership in financial transformation — both internally and externally.


**Your Qualifications**
* A passion for problem-solving at the intersection of finance and technology.
* Strong communication and presentation skills with a talent for making complex ideas clear and persuasive.
* The ability to listen deeply, understand client pain, and respond with impactful solutions.
* An entrepreneurial mindset—comfortable owning your pipeline, your demo strategy, and your impact.
* A strong grasp of value-based selling and storytelling, not just showing features and functions.


**Preferred Experience**
* Experience in a presales, solution consulting, or finance transformation role in a SaaS or enterprise software environment.
* Hands-on knowledge of FP&A processes: forecasting, budgeting, modelling, scenario planning.
* Background with EPM, CPM, ERP, BI, or related enterprise planning tools.
* Affinity for financial planning, modelling, and analysis.


**Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging (DEIB)**
 We believe attracting and retaining the best talent and fostering an inclusive culture strengthens our business. DEIB improves our workforce, enhances trust with our partners and customers, and drives business success. Build your career in a place where diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging aren’t just words on paper – this is what drives our innovation, it’s how we connect, and it contributes to what makes us a market leader. We believe in a hiring and working environment where all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day!
   

  

 We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive equitable benefits and all privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
   

  

**Fraud Recruitment Disclaimer** 
  

  

 It has come to our attention that fraudulent and fictitious job opportunities are being circulated on the Internet. Prospective candidates are being contacted by certain individuals, mainly through telephone calls, emails and correspondence, claiming they are representatives of Anaplan. The main purpose of these correspondences and announcements is to obtain privileged information from individuals.
   

  

 Anaplan does not:
   

  

* Extend offers to candidates without an extensive interview process with a member of our recruitment team and a hiring manager via video or in person.
* Send job offers via email. All offers are first extended verbally by a member of our internal recruitment team whenever possible and then followed up via written communication.


 All emails from Anaplan would come from an @anaplan.com email address. Should you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Anaplan, please send an email to people@anaplan.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.

title: Manager Service Management – Large Business Delivery & Support
description:
**Letar du efter en arbetsplats för framtiden?**
 Hos oss är karriären din. Här får du möjlighet att styra den i riktningen du drömmer om och samtidigt vara delaktig i tekniska innovationer som idag knappt ens finns i fantasin. Innovationer som vi vet kommer rita om kartan för hur vi kommunicerar med varandra och lever våra uppkopplade liv i framtiden. Letar du efter en arbetsplats där du får vara med och bidra till det viktigaste som finns – relationerna människor emellan? Välkommen till oss på Telenor.
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens leveransorganisation hos Telenor? Vi söker nu en
 **Manager Service Management** 
 till vår ledningsgrupp för
 **Large Business Delivery & Support** 
 – en nyckelroll där du får möjlighet att påverka, förbättra och leda medarbetare i en verksamhet som står i centrum för våra största företagskunder.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Manager of Service Management leder du ett team om ca 12 dedikerade Service Managers som ansvarar för proaktiv support och utveckling av Telenors största företagskunder. Tillsammans med teamet säkerställer du en hög kundnöjdhet och arbetar med ständiga förbättringar för att optimera arbetet på bästa möjliga sätt. Du tillsammans med ditt team är motorn som driver arbetet framåt och garanterar att viktiga kundinsikter når in i Telenors organisation.
   

  

 I rollen väntar inte bara möjligheten att inspirera och utveckla teamet – med hjälp av ett datadrivet arbetssätt och förmåga att kunna framställa relevanta utvecklingsmål och krav lyfter ni tillsammans kvalitetsnivån till nya höjder. Du behöver utmana det invanda och driva en förändring från mer reaktiva till proaktiva arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 På Telenor arbetar vi med ett styrkebaserat och coachande ledarskap och du förväntas löpande ha dialog med dina medarbetare och inspirera till utveckling och nya tankesätt. Vi erbjuder många möjligheter till ledarskapsutveckling, både inom Telenor i stort och även i den ledningsgrupp du kommer tillhöra.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 För att lyckas i rollen behöver du etablera ett gott samarbete både inom och utanför teamet, bland annat vår säljorganisation, leveransavdelningar och supportfunktioner. Vi arbetar med komplexa och ofta unika kundlösningar där Service Management är sammanhållande och därför behövs en kombination av strategisk förståelse och operativ kompetens.
   

  

* Du har framgångsrikt arbetat med ledarskap och teamutveckling (minst 5+ år) samt brinner för att skapa stark sammanhållning och samarbete över teamgränser.
* Du har erfarenhet av att arbeta inom operations på ett större bolag, gärna med fokus på drift, support och/eller leverans.
* Du har en genuin vilja att lära, utmana och utvecklas för att hjälpa Telenor att möta kunders ständigt föränderliga behov.
* Du har en god affärs- och strategisk förståelse som du kan omsätta i operationell effektivitet och arbetar med ett holistiskt synsätt.
* Du har en god kommunikativ förmåga och talar svenska och engelska flytande
* För dig är det naturligt att navigera inom SLA:er, KPI:er för att kunna omsätta det i processutveckling.


 Det är meriterande om du arbetat inom telekom eller IT med fokus på komplexa kundlösningar.
   

  

**Sök till oss idag**
 Vill du ta ditt nästa steg i karriären med oss? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Vi träffar kandidater löpande så hör av dig redan idag.
   

  

 Om du har frågor och vill veta mer är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande ledare Stina Reutercrona på stina.reutercrona@telenor.se Vi kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökan via mejl. Sista ansökningsdag är 26:e oktober 2025.
   

  

**Vårt löfte till dig**
*Vi är bättre tillsammans.* 
 Hos oss möts du av en familjär och inkluderande kultur, en stark gemensam värdegrund och ett ledarskap som ger dig frihet och handlingskraft. Vi tror på att ge varandra förtroende och frihet att agera och fatta beslut, samtidigt som vi är där för varandra i med- och motgångar.
   

  

*Vi stöttar relationer och samhällen.* 
 Telenor är ett samhällsbärande företag och här får ditt arbete ett större syfte. Vi skapar värde för miljoner människor varje dag och har ett kundnära förhållningssätt där mänskliga relationer står i centrum.
   

  

*Vi ger plats för livet.* 
 Arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan om du vill, så länge dina arbetsuppgifter gör det möjligt. Resten av tiden skapar vi magi tillsammans på kontoret. Två give-me-a-break-days per år ger en extra paus och flexibla arbetstider hjälper dig att balansera jobbet och livet. Vi finns där genom livets alla faser och erbjuder trygghetspaket i form av bl.a. kollektivavtal, tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet att skräddarsy försäkringslösningar som passar just dig, för ditt behov här och nu.
   

  

*Vi bjuder in till en spännande karriärresa.* 
 Din utveckling står i centrum och hos oss är lärande en del av kulturen. Vi avsätter 40 timmar om året för att du ska kunna fördjupa dig, utforska nya områden och växa i din roll. Genom Telenor Academy och andra lärandeinitiativ får du verktygen och friheten att forma din egen karriär. När du vill vidare väntar möjligheter i hela Norden.
   

  

**Bra att känna till**
 Enligt Telenors policy genomför vi bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat i samtliga rekryteringar.

title: Digital Analyst
company_industry: Retail, Internet Marketplace Platforms, and Retail Apparel and Fashion
description:
*💙 Sellpy’s vision is to empower everyone to live circularly. We see a tremendous financial, social and environmental value in making sure unused items are put to use again. We are looking for colleagues who share this vision, and who are ready to see their work contribute to a sustainable future.* 




  





**Digital Analyst at Sellpy** 




 We are looking for a Digital Analyst who will take full ownership of Sellpy’s digital tracking and continuously improve it with a clear focus on business goals. In this role, you will be the go-to expert for ensuring that our marketing channels have the most reliable and actionable data possible, always within the boundaries of GDPR.
 



  





 You’ll help us strengthen our data-driven approach to marketing spend by coming up with new ideas, developing tests, and evaluating performance across channels. By building the foundation for best-in-class tracking, you’ll empower our teams to make better decisions and push Sellpy’s growth forward.
 



  





**In short, you will** 



* Own and continuously improve Sellpy’s digital tracking setup.
* Ensure high-quality marketing data that fuels performance decisions.
* Implement and optimize event tracking and GTM configurations.
* Drive A/B testing across our site and CRM to improve performance.
* Translate data into actionable insights for marketing and commercial teams.
* Contribute to a culture of experimentation by proposing and testing new ideas.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* 2+ years of experience in a similar role.
* Strong experience with GA4, Looker, Funnel.io or similar tools.
* Solid understanding of BigQuery and SQL.
* Hands-on experience with technical tracking implementations (events, GTM).
* Background in A/B testing and performance marketing.



  





**Nice to Have** 



* Experience with SEO.
* Knowledge of Python.
* Familiarity with geo-lift tests for evaluating marketing performance.



  





 You are analytical, structured and proactive, with a genuine curiosity of data and problem-solving. You enjoy turning data into clear insights, keep both details and the bigger picture in mind and thrive when collaborating with others to create real impact.
 



  





**You get to** 



* Be part of a tech-minded company that's driving the change towards a sustainable lifestyle. In return, you will get direction, energy, and work on meaningful challenges daily
* Work with highly skilled and motivated colleagues
* Make use of prepaid vacation
* Enjoy Sellpy credits and staff discounts at Sellpy and the H&M brands (Arket, COS, Other Stories, Weekday and more)
* Save up with a monthly pension plan
* Engagement in Sellpy’s social traditions with game nights, interactive planning days, guest speakers and other activities



  





**Location:** 
 You are welcome to do all these things at our new office at Medborgarplatsen in Stockholm, and from home.
 



  





**Hybrid work:** 
 We work flexibly with a hybrid setup. During the onboarding phase, you are expected to spend more time in the office to get to know the team and the role. Over time, most roles include around 50% office presence, with some variation depending on team and tasks.
 



  





**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time
 



  





**Start:** 
 As agreed upon
 



  





 Ready to make an impact? Send in your application today — we’re excited to hear from you! 💙

title: Customer Success Associate (French speaking)
description:
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience to entrepreneurs and partners? We are hiring for a committed
 **french speaking** 
**Customer Success Associate** 
 to join our dynamic team!
   

  

**About Froda**
 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear mission: to democratize the access to financing and provide small businesses the same opportunities to grow as large ones. Through digital processes and technological innovation, we have shortened the loan process from months to minutes, making it easy for business owners to invest in their ideas.
   

  

 At Froda, we are making fair, fast, and accessible financing the new standard. But we’re not stopping there. Through embedded lending, we’re seamlessly integrating our technology into the world’s leading banks and fintechs, creating a future where businesses get the funding they need instantly, right where they are. Backed by cutting-edge tech and bold ambition, we’re building the next generation of lending infrastructure. Join our team and contribute to giving small businesses the opportunity to invest in their ideas to the best possible terms.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, you will be the first point of contact for our customers, essential in providing high-quality support and contributing to their overall satisfaction. Your talent for understanding customer needs, coupled with your problem-solving skills, will not only resolve their issues but also enrich their experience with Froda.
   

  

 In addition to supporting our end customers, you will also play a key role in supporting our embedded partner collaborations ensuring they receive the same level of outstanding service and engagement as our direct customers.
   

  

**You will**
* Deliver exceptional customer service via email, and phone.
* Support and guide our partners’ support teams by answering questions, solving issues, and ensuring they have what they need to deliver a great experience to their users.
* Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve customer issues efficiently.
* Cross collaborate with other teams such as Product to share customer feedback to improve our services.


**Who You Are**
* Native or fluent proficiency in French.
* You possess excellent communication skills in both English and Swedish.
* Experience in customer service, support, or a similar role is preferred.
* You have an empathetic approach to handling customer queries and complaints.
* You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working with both customers and external partners.
* Able to multitask and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* You are tech-savvy and comfortable navigating customer support platforms and tools.


**What’s in it for you?**
 Working at Froda is everything you can expect from working at a tech scale: fun and fast-paced. We are 90+ ambitious people who work together mostly at the office, with few scheduled meetings. The culture is friendly, with a get-shit-done attitude. At Froda, you will truly have freedom under responsibility. This means that you will have the ability to impact your own work and tackle a wider set of tasks.
   

  

 Furthermore, you’ll get:
   

  

* Fun & exciting work environment in a fast-growing and profitable scale-up
* Competitive compensation package
* Insurance and pension plan
* The possibility to work in our awesome office in Stockholm
* Friendly culture that values work/life balance
* Monthly after-works that are actually fun


 If you're passionate about delivering unparalleled customer service, both to entrepreneurs and to our partners and want to be part of our mission to redefine the banking experience, apply to join us as a Customer Success Associate today!

title: Verksamhetsarkitekt
description:
Vill du vara med och forma framtidens Skandia – i en roll där du får bidra till strategisk transformation, verksamhetsutveckling och långsiktig riktning? Som verksamhetsarkitekt blir du en nyckelperson i att driva förändring tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor i en värderingsstyrd organisation, där du också har möjlighet att påverka både vår framtid och din egen roll.
   

  

**Att jobba som**
 Som verksamhetsarkitekt på Skandia är du med och skapar strukturell klarhet i komplexa sammanhang. Du tar ett helhetsgrepp om hur affär, verksamhet och IT hänger ihop – och ser till att våra förändringsinitiativ vilar på en stabil och långsiktigt hållbar grund. Rollen innebär att du stöttar affärsområdena i taktisk och strategisk planering, i utredningar och i prioriterade förändringsarbeten. Du hjälper till att visualisera och analysera nuläge och önskat läge, bland annat genom modeller som förmågekartor, process- och begreppsmodeller.
   

  

 Du bidrar aktivt till att forma målbilder och inriktningar som vägleder Skandia mot våra strategiska mål – och säkerställer samtidigt att kraven på IT-stöd speglar verksamhetens verkliga behov. En viktig del av ditt uppdrag är att se till att vår verksamhetsarkitektur och tillhörande ramverk är väl förankrade, användbara och stödjer både affärsplanering och förmågan att möta förändring i omvärlden.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även att arbeta aktivt med omvärldsbevakning, kommunikation och kunskapsspridning i organisationen. Du rapporterar till BIO Försäkring och blir en nyckelperson i att skapa struktur, riktning och samsyn i ett bolag som har både samhällsansvar och kundvärde som grundläggande drivkrafter.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett team av erfarna arkitekter och rapporterar till chefen för BIO (Business Information Officer) Försäkring.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 För att lyckas som verksamhetsarkitekt hos oss behöver du ha förmågan att se sammanhang, lyfta blicken och navigera i en komplex miljö med många beroenden. Du tänker strategiskt, är analytisk och har ett starkt helhetsperspektiv – samtidigt som du har en god förmåga att ta dig an uppgifter på ett strukturerat och lösningsorienterat sätt.
   

  

 Du har ett agilt förhållningssätt till förändring, är van att jobba med flera perspektiv parallellt och har en naturlig fallenhet för att bygga relationer och skapa samarbete över organisatoriska gränser. Din kommunikativa förmåga gör att du skapar tydlighet och samsyn även i komplexa frågor, och du trivs i roller där du får bidra till riktning, struktur och beslut.
   

  

 Rollen kräver starkt självledarskap och exekutiv förmåga – du driver saker framåt med både ansvar och omdöme. Det är också meriterande om du är visionär och har en coachande och engagerande stil i ditt samarbete med andra.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en viktig del av ett sammanhang där det finns utrymme att påverka, bidra och utvecklas. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och skapa värde både för kund och samhälle – med arkitekturen som verktyg för att leda förändring i rätt riktning.
   

  

 För Att Trivas Och Lyckas i Rollen Behöver Du Ha Stark Verksamhetsförståelse Inom Försäkring, Samt God Kommunikativ Förmåga På Både Svenska Och Engelska. Vi Ser Även Att Du Har
   

  

* Mycket god kunskap om försäkring, särskilt Liv- och pensionsbranschen, och dess processer
