title: Krav- och testledare
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 4+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
Uppdragsbeskrivning
  
Vi söker en Krav- och Testledare.
  
Verksamheten utvecklar IT och systemstöd på ett agilt och teambaserat sätt inom en gemensam projekt- och förvaltningsportfölj. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan mellan roller som produktägare, projektledare, utvecklare och testledare.
  
Ett pågående projekt syftar till att ta fram ett nytt IT-stöd.Testledaren ingår i teamet och ansvarar för att leveranserna uppfyller krav och kvalitet ur ett testperspektiv.
  
  

**Arbetet handlar om att:**  

Stödja och handleda anställd i testarbetet
  
Planera och genomföra testaktiviteter
  
Hålla i acceptanstester med användarna
  
Följa upp och dokumentera testaktiviteter
  
Designa och validera testfall
  
Verifiera tester och identifiera brister
  
Genomföra utforskande tester för att identifiera oväntade beteenden
  
Skaffa ett helhetsperspektiv och identifiera områden där tester saknas eller behöver förbättras
  
  

**Kvalifikationer:****SKA-Krav:**  

**Du har kompetensnivå:** 3 som testledare/testare (4-8års erfarenhet)
  
Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat
  
Du har minst 2 års erfarenhet som testledare
  
Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet, minst 1 år de senaste 5 åren, av arbete med testarbete i en större organisation
  
Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av testarbete inom agila utvecklingsteam och kunskap om metoder som Scrum, Kanban eller motsvarande. (Minst ett genomfört uppdrag inom ett agilt utvecklingsteam med en uppdragslängd på minst 1 år de senaste 5 åren)
  
  

**BÖR-Krav:**  

Du bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med tester i verktyget Azure DevOps eller motsvarande.
  
Du bör ha erfarenhet av arbete enligt förvaltningsmodellen pm3.
  
Du bör ha lång erfarenhet av test/testledning av informationssystem för regulatoriska och administrativa processer inom Hälsoområdet.
  
Du bör ha erfarenhet av arbete inom statlig verksamhet de senaste 5 åren och dess lagstiftning (Förvaltningslagen, Arkivlagen, Offentlighets- och sekretesslagen).
  
Du bör ha erfarenhet av handledning och utbildning av andra
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: AWS certified SW Engineer
description:
AWS-certified Engineer – B2B Solutions
  
Cloud Family is a fast-growing Swedish SaaS company and AWS partner. We help businesses build, scale, and optimize solutions on the AWS platform. Our customers range from ambitious startups to established enterprises — and we’re expanding our technical team to support that growth.
  
We’re now looking for AWS-certified (Pro or Specialty) engineers who wants to work on modern, scalable B2B solutions.
  
What you’ll do
  
Design, build, and maintain secure, reliable, and cost-efficient solutions on AWS.
  
Work with services like EC2, ECS/EKS, Lambda, API Gateway, S3, RDS, DynamoDB, CloudFront, and more.
  
Collaborate with product and business teams to deliver B2B solutions that solve real problems.
  
Automate infrastructure and deployments using modern DevOps tools and practices.
  
Help shape architecture, security, and operational best practices across projects.
  
Contribute to internal tooling and platform improvements.
  
Your background
  
AWS Certified Professional or Specialty (e.g., Solutions Architect Pro, DevOps Pro, Security, Machine Learning, or similar).
  
Strong practical experience with AWS services and architectures.
  
Proficiency in scripting or programming (e.g., Python, TypeScript, Bash, Terraform, or CloudFormation).
  
Familiarity with B2B or enterprise solutions, APIs, and integrations.
  
Strong problem-solving mindset and ability to work both independently and in a team.
  
  

Why Cloud Family?
  
Work hands-on with modern AWS solutions in real customer environments.
  
Small, experienced team with low bureaucracy and lots of impact.
  
Flexible remote or hybrid work setup.
  
Competitive compensation and potential for stock options.
  
Opportunities to grow with the company as we scale internationally.
  
  

Interested?
  
Send your CV or LinkedIn profile to info@cloudfamily.com.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer for a client assignment in Stockholm. The role suits you who thrive in a fast-paced environment, where you get to combine technical expertise with coaching leadership.
  
About the role
  
You will work to drive and implement security and development practices within ALM platforms and DevOps tools. The role involves both strategic and operational work, where you support the development teams in their CI/CD processes, optimize internal working methods and contribute to technical innovation.
  
  

**Examples of tasks:**  

Implement and promote security routines in development environments
  
Support and coach development teams in DevOps principles
  
Evaluate and standardize tools and processes
  
Onboard new users and adapt existing tools
  
Collaborate closely with product owners to prioritize backlog and improvements
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

At least 5 years of experience in DevOps or ALM
  
Academic degree in systems development or equivalent
  
Good knowledge of Azure DevOps, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Azure Cloud
  
Experience with Microsoft products, preferably AWS/Azure
  
Fluent English, Swedish is an asset
  
  

**Personal qualities:**  

You are structured, communicative and solution-oriented with the ability to both work independently and collaborate in a team.
  
**Location:** Stockholm (at least 50% on site)
  
**Scope:** 100%
  
**Start:** September 15, 2025
  
**End:** June 30, 2026
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Testautomatiserare till Frenda
description:
Frenda är ett svenskt produktbolag som utvecklar och levererar en heltäckande, molnbaserad SaaS-lösning. Vår plattform erbjuder en allt-i-ett-lösning inklusive journalsystem, röntgen- och bildbehandling samt säker lagring och backup. Vår produkt är marknadsledande i Sverige och högt uppskattad av våra kunder. Med en stabil affär, lönsamhet och en växande kundbas står vi inför en spännande expansionsresa.

**Om Rollen**


Som **Testautomatiserare** hos Frenda blir du en nyckelperson i att etablera testautomatisering från grunden. Du kommer in i ett erfaret testteam med mycket produktkunskap och ett starkt kvalitetsfokus – och din roll blir att omsätta det i smarta testflöden, bättre struktur och hållbara verktyg.


Du får stort inflytande över teknikval, arbetssätt och strategi. I början kommer du arbeta både med manuell testning och med att gradvis bygga upp automatiseringen – för att på sikt flytta allt mer av testningen till automatiserade flöden.

**Du kommer att:**

* Bygga upp grunden för testautomatisering – välja verktyg, ramverk och metodik som passar vår miljö
* Utveckla, underhålla och förbättra automatiserade tester för centrala flöden
* Arbeta tätt med utvecklingsteamen för att säkra testbarhet och integrera testning genom hela utvecklingsprocessen
* Dokumentera testfall, resultat och testrapporter i Azure DevOps
* Driva kontinuerlig förbättring av testprocesser, arbetssätt och kvalitet

**Vi tror att du har**

* 4+ års erfarenhet inom testning
* Stark kunskap om och erfarenhet av automatiserade tester
* Erfarenhet av att testa komplexa, verksamhetskritiska system
* Vana av att dokumentera testfall och analysera krav
  

**Varför Frenda?**

* Lönsamt bolag på tillväxtresa – med trygg, långsiktig ägare
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, pensionslösningar och försäkringar
* Hybrid arbetsmodell med kontor vid Hötorget
* Semesterbostäder i bla. Alperna, Barcelona och franska rivieran


Vill du arbeta med något som faktiskt spelar roll? Välkommen till Frenda.


 Skicka in din ansökan idag – eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer.


  
Avdelning
Tech
Platser
Stockholm
Distansarbete

title: DevOps Engineer Internship
description:
**About Justera Group**
=======================


Justera Group AB is a leading Swedish IT consulting firm specializing in building high-performing technology teams and delivering end-to-end IT solutions. Led by dynamic female executives, Justera Group focuses on helping businesses harness the power of digital technologies to continuously evolve in today's rapidly changing economy.


The company has deep expertise in IT consultancy, software development, and recruitment services, providing clients with purpose-driven, well-trained consultants who consistently deliver efficient and effective results. Justera Group manages the entire talent lifecycle—from hiring to ongoing management—ensuring the right fit for each project on time and within budget.


With a strong commitment to quality, collaboration, and client success, Justera Group is a trusted partner for technology innovation across Sweden.

**About the Role**
------------------


We're looking for a **DevOps Engineer Intern** who is passionate about cloud infrastructure, CI/CD automation, and modern deployment practices. You'll help design, implement, and maintain scalable cloud environments using AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform, while gaining hands-on experience with real production-grade DevOps pipelines.


This internship offers an opportunity to work closely with an experienced engineering team and learn how to build and manage infrastructure for distributed systems.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* ️ Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions and ArgoCD
* ️ Deploy and manage containerized services on AWS with Kubernetes (K3s/EKS)
* Configure and manage API Gateway (Kong) and authentication services (Logto)
* Implement and manage Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform
* Set up and monitor Prometheus and Grafana for metrics and observability
* Work with PostgreSQL, Redis, and other infrastructure components
* Optimize container builds, version control workflows, and deployment automation
* ‍ Collaborate with developers to ensure smooth deployment and infrastructure reliability

**Tech Stack**
--------------

* **Cloud:** AWS
* **Auth & Gateway:** Logto, Kong
* **Database:** PostgreSQL, Redis
* **Languages:** Bash, YAML, JavaScript/TypeScript, Python
* **Infrastructure:** Docker, Kubernetes (K3s/EKS/GKE), Terraform
* **CI/CD:** GitHub Actions, ArgoCD
* **Monitoring:** Prometheus, Grafana
* **Version Control:** Git, GitHub

**Requirements**
----------------

* Pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field
* Basic understanding of AWS, Linux systems, and networking fundamentals
* Familiarity with Docker and container orchestration (Kubernetes)
* ️ Interest in CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and infrastructure automation
* Eagerness to learn modern DevOps tools and cloud-native systems
* Strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment

**What You'll Gain**
--------------------

* Hands-on experience with cloud-native DevOps practices
* Mentorship from experienced engineers
* Exposure to Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD, and monitoring tools
* Opportunity for full-time employment upon successful completion

**What We Offer**
-----------------

* A dynamic and innovative workplace driving advancements in cutting-edge technologies
* The opportunity to collaborate with talented cross-functional teams on meaningful and impactful projects
* A supportive culture that fosters continuous learning, growth, and professional development
* Flexible hybrid working model for an optimal work-life balance

**How to Apply**
----------------


*Justera Group is committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates.*

title: Testautomatiserare till Frenda
description:
Frenda är ett svenskt produktbolag som utvecklar och levererar en heltäckande, molnbaserad SaaS-lösning. Vår plattform erbjuder en allt-i-ett-lösning inklusive journalsystem, röntgen- och bildbehandling samt säker lagring och backup. Vår produkt är marknadsledande i Sverige och högt uppskattad av våra kunder. Med en stabil affär, lönsamhet och en växande kundbas står vi inför en spännande expansionsresa.

**Om Rollen**


Som **Testautomatiserare** hos Frenda blir du en nyckelperson i att etablera testautomatisering från grunden. Du kommer in i ett erfaret testteam med mycket produktkunskap och ett starkt kvalitetsfokus – och din roll blir att omsätta det i smarta testflöden, bättre struktur och hållbara verktyg.


Du får stort inflytande över teknikval, arbetssätt och strategi. I början kommer du arbeta både med manuell testning och med att gradvis bygga upp automatiseringen – för att på sikt flytta allt mer av testningen till automatiserade flöden.

**Du kommer att:**

* Bygga upp grunden för testautomatisering – välja verktyg, ramverk och metodik som passar vår miljö
* Utveckla, underhålla och förbättra automatiserade tester för centrala flöden
* Arbeta tätt med utvecklingsteamen för att säkra testbarhet och integrera testning genom hela utvecklingsprocessen
* Dokumentera testfall, resultat och testrapporter i Azure DevOps
* Driva kontinuerlig förbättring av testprocesser, arbetssätt och kvalitet

**Vi tror att du har**

* 4+ års erfarenhet inom testning
* Stark kunskap om och erfarenhet av automatiserade tester
* Erfarenhet av att testa komplexa, verksamhetskritiska system
* Vana av att dokumentera testfall och analysera krav
  

**Varför Frenda?**

* Lönsamt bolag på tillväxtresa – med trygg, långsiktig ägare
* Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner, pensionslösningar och försäkringar
* Hybrid arbetsmodell med kontor vid Hötorget
* Semesterbostäder i bla. Alperna, Barcelona och franska rivieran


Vill du arbeta med något som faktiskt spelar roll? Välkommen till Frenda.


Skicka in din ansökan idag – eller hör av dig om du vill veta mer.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Join Ericsson’s DevOps team focused on CI pipelines and build automation. Help maintain and evolve our build machinery, improve automation, and enable fast, reliable delivery across projects. You’ll work in a collaborative, agile team using modern CI/CD tools and message-bus integrations.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Own and improve CI/CD pipelines and build processes (Jenkins, Argo).
* Build SW artifacts and improve the build process (Yocto).
* Implement automation scripts and tools (Bash, Python, Java/Groovy) and integrate with RabbitMQ/Kafka.
* Troubleshoot pipeline issues, run improvement projects, and collaborate with teams to ensure production readiness.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Strong scripting/programming: Bash, Python; experience with Java/Groovy is a plus.
* Hands-on experience with Jenkins and Argo, and message buses (RabbitMQ or Kafka).
* Comfortable with Agile ways of working (Scrum/Kanban), cross-team collaboration, and keeping an overview of pipeline health.
* Curious problem-solver who enjoys automating repetitive work and building smart, reliable tooling.
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: DevOps Engineer with GCP
description:
* Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform
* Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards
* Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products
* Be a productive member of the team.


 Requirements
   

  

* Demonstrated expertise as a DevOps Engineer, Site Reliability Engineer (SRE), or Platform Engineer within Google Cloud Platform (GCP) environments.
* Proficient in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with extensive hands-on experience using Terraform for scalable and maintainable cloud infrastructure.
* Deep understanding of GCP networking and security concepts, including VPCs, firewall configurations, service mesh architectures, and private service access.
* Strong grasp of Identity and Access Management (IAM), secrets management solutions, and enforcement of least-privilege access controls.
* Proven experience in designing, implementing, and automating CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, with a focus on reliability and repeatability.
* Well-versed in modern observability practices, including setup and management of Cloud Logging, Cloud Monitoring, Prometheus/Grafana dashboards, and efficient alerting and incident response workflows.
* Practical experience managing containerized applications using Docker, Kubernetes (GKE), and service mesh solutions such as Istio or Anthos.
* Strong collaboration skills with a focus on clear documentation and enablement of development teams across the organization.
* We are looking for a candidate preferably in Sweden or otherwise in Nordics.


 Benefits
   

  

* A challenging, innovating environment.
* Opportunities for learning where needed.

title: Cloud Engineer - Deployment Specialist
description:
**Job Title: Cloud Engineer - Deployment Specialist** 




**Location: Stockholm** 




  





**Experience Level: Senior-Level, 8-20 years ex** 




  





**Industry** 
 : FinTech
 



  





**Job Summary** 




 We are seeking a skilled Cloud Engineer – Deployment Specialist to join our clients infrastructure and DevOps team. This role is ideal for professionals with deep experience in managing complex, multi-cluster, and multi-region deployments on AWS, and a strong command of cloud-native technologies and CI/CD automation tools.
 



 The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud-based deployments with a high degree of automation, scalability, and resilience. You will play a key role in streamlining deployment workflows, ensuring high availability, and enabling continuous delivery across distributed environments.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* Deploy, and manage multi-cluster and multi-region AWS infrastructure.
* Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters for scalability, security, and performance.
* Implement and manage deployment pipelines using Harness, Jenkins, and GitLab CI/CD.
* Integrate and manage messaging and streaming systems using Apache Kafka.
* Utilize Cilium for container networking and security policies within Kubernetes.
* Work with Gradle for build automation in complex Java-based environments.
* Develop automation and tooling in Python to support infrastructure and deployment needs.
* Administer and troubleshoot Unix/Linux based systems and environments.
* Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve system performance, reliability, and security.
* Collaborate with development, QA, and product teams to ensure smooth software delivery.
* Implement best practices in infrastructure as code (IaC), security, and observability.



  





  





**Required Qualifications** 




  




* Proven hands-on experience with AWS, specifically in multi-cluster and multi-region environments.
* Expertise in Kubernetes administration and Helm.
* Experience with Harness or other deployment orchestration tools.
* Solid understanding of Kafka setup and operations in cloud environments.
* Working knowledge of Cilium for Kubernetes networking and security policies.
* Strong command of Unix/Linux systems administration.
* Experience with Gradle in large-scale build environments.
* Proficiency in Python scripting for automation and tooling.
* Experience in configuring and managing CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and GitLab.
* Familiarity with DevSecOps principles and secure deployment practices.



  





  





**Preferred Qualifications** 




  




* AWS certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect, DevOps Engineer).
* Experience with Terraform or other IaC tools.
* Familiarity with service mesh technologies.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or in a team.
* Excellent communication and documentation skills.

title: Devops / Release engineer
description:
We are seeking a
 **DevOps / Release Engineer** 
 to join Property Tech team and help bridge the gap between development, operations, and security. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the infrastructure and release machinery that powers our digital product. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, loves solving complex problems, and is passionate about continuous improvement.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, implement, and manage CI/CD pipelines to ensure smooth and reliable software delivery.
* Automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration using tools Terraform.
* Monitor system performance, availability, and security; proactively identify and resolve issues.
* Collaborate with developers to improve build processes, deployments, and observability.
* Manage cloud environments (GCP & Azure) including networking, scaling, and cost optimization.
* Ensure security best practices across infrastructure, deployments, and secrets management (Vault).
* Implement logging, monitoring, and alerting solutions ( Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, Datadog).
* Support incident response and root cause analysis to minimize downtime.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field (or equivalent experience).
* 3+ years of experience in a DevOps, Site Reliability, or related engineering role.
* Strong scripting skills (Bash, Python, or similar).
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, CircleCI, etc.).
* Proficiency with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm).
* Experience with cloud platforms (GCP / Azure).
* Master of infrastructure as code (Terraform).
* Familiarity with monitoring and observability tools.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment.


 ⸻
   

  

**Nice to Have**
* Experience with security practices in DevOps (DevSecOps).
* Knowledge of service mesh, API gateways, or microservice architectures.

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Engineering Services, Automation Machinery Manufacturing, and Commercial and Service Industry Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a** 
**Data Engineer to be based at our office/ our customer’s site in** 
**Stockholm** 




  





  





 Our Digital Enterprise Solutions (DES) Department leverages extensive manufacturing know-how for enlightened enterprise systems. Our deep industry experience allows us to drastically reduce process time and effectively streamline business flows for any organization. Our world-class consultants enable organizations to realize the power of the integrated enterprise by providing superior consulting and implementation services.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 We are seeking a skilled Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support marketing, and analytics use cases within a Customer Data Platform (CDP), specifically Treasure Data. The ideal candidate will collaborate across teams to ensure data quality, enable personalization, and drive data-driven decision-making.
 



  





**Area of Responsibility** 




  




* Design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines for ingestion, transformation, and delivery.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather data requirements and ensure consistency across systems.
* Support marketing and analytics teams in leveraging CDP capabilities, especially within Treasure Data.
* Develop and maintain data models for reporting, segmentation, and personalization.
* Implement and manage CI/CD pipelines for data workflows and deployments.
* Monitor and optimize workflows using orchestration tools such as DigDag.
* Perform advanced SQL queries for data validation, transformation, and analysis.
* Efficiently manage and query large-scale datasets using Snowflake.
* Ensure integration of Treasure Data CDP with marketing platforms and data pipelines



**Knowledge / Experience** 



* Proficiency in SQL for querying, data manipulation, and performance tuning.
* Experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., DigDag, DBT, Airflow).
* Strong understanding of ETL/ELT processes and data integration best practices.
* Knowledge of data modeling techniques for operational and analytical use cases.
* Familiarity with CI/CD practices in data engineering (e.g., Git, dbt Cloud).
* Hands-on experience with Snowflake or similar cloud data warehouses.
* Understanding of Treasure Data CDP and its ecosystem.
* Experience in marketing or customer data environments.
* Awareness of data governance, lineage, and observability tools



  





  





**In return for bringing your expertise to our business we offer a competitive salary along with excellent benefits including:** 




  




* Pension Scheme – We match employee contribution up to 5% of salary
* 25 Days’ Holiday
* Private Health Care
* Tata Jaguar Land Rover Privilege Scheme - up to 20% off new JLR vehicles
* Group Income Protection
* Health Assured – Employee Assistance Program
* Group Life Assurance
* Health Shield – Private Health Cash Plan



  





**If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on and want to join a global company, then this is the place for you.** 




  





**Tata Technologies: Engineering a better world.**

title: Senior Solutions Engineer
description:
REQ# FEQ426R434
   

  

 At Databricks, our core principles are at the heart of everything we do; creating a culture of proactiveness and a customer-centric mindset guides us to create a unified platform that makes data science and analytics accessible to everyone. We aim to inspire our customers to make informed decisions that push their business forward. We provide a user-friendly and intuitive platform that makes it easy to turn insights into action and fosters a culture of creativity, experimentation, and continuous improvement. You will be an essential part of this mission, using your technical expertise to demonstrate how our Data Intelligence Platform can help customers solve their complex data challenges. You'll work with a collaborative, customer-focused team who values innovation and creativity, using your skills to create customized solutions to help our customers achieve their goals and guide their businesses forward. Join us in our quest to change how people work with data and make a better world!
   

  

**The Impact You Will Have**
* Form successful relationships with clients throughout your assigned territory to provide technical and business value in collaboration with an Account Executive and a Senior Solutions Architect.
* Gain excitement from clients about Databricks through hands-on evaluation and Spark programming, integrating with the wider cloud ecosystem and 3rd party applications.
* Contribute to building the Databricks technical community through engagement at workshops, seminars, and meet-ups.
* Become a Big Data Analytics advisor on aspects of architecture and design.
* Support your customers by authoring reference architectures, how-tos, and demo applications.
* Develop both technically and in the pre-sales aspect with the goal of becoming an independently operating Solutions Architect.


**What We Look For**
 Familiarity working with clients, creating a narrative, answering customer questions, aligning the agenda with important interests, and achieving tangible outcomes.Ability to independently deliver a technical proposition, identify customers' pain-points, and explain important areas for business value to develop a trusted advisor skillset.
   

  

* Code in a core programming language such as Python or SQL.


 Knowledgeable in a core Big Data Analytics domain with some exposure to advanced proofs-of-concept and an understanding of a major public cloud platform.
   

  

* Experience diving deeper into solution architecture and Data Engineering.


**About Databricks**
 Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
   

  

**Benefits**
 At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.
   

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

**Compliance**
**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Solutions Architect (BQA / NATO) Long-Term Contract, Remote (Europe)
description:
Role Overview
   

  

 You will define and lead the architecture of large, secure systems across the full stack in the context of defense and security contracts. You will work closely with engineering, security, and stakeholder teams to ensure architectural integrity, scalability, performance, and compliance with NATO / BQA standards.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Own the end-to-end system architecture: define modules, interfaces, integration patterns, data flow
* Translate high-level requirements into architectural blueprints, design patterns, and implementation guidance
* Ensure all designs integrate compliance, security, and operational requirements from the start
* Lead architecture reviews, vet designs, and enforce consistency across subsystems
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (DevOps, Security, Infrastructure, Development)
* Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and decision-making in complex scenarios
* Evaluate new technologies, frameworks, and tools to improve architecture
* Document architectures, decisions, trade-offs, and system rationales
* Interface with clients, auditors, and stakeholders to justify architectural choices


**Mandatory Requirements** 
  

  

* Domain & High-Security Experience
+ Minimum 7+ years as a Solutions Architect or equivalent in security, defense, or highly regulated environments
+ Prior experience designing systems for NATO / BQA / defense / classified / governmental domains

* Architectural Competence
+ Proven ability to design end-to-end systems (frontend, backend, infrastructure, integration, security)
+ Experienced in microservices, event-driven, domain-driven design, distributed systems
+ Deep understanding of system decomposition, modularization, scaling, resiliency

* Security & Compliance in Architecture
+ Expertise embedding security patterns: authentication, authorization, encryption, IAM, zero-trust
+ Familiarity with threat models, attack surfaces, risk mitigation strategies
+ Experience designing systems to meet compliance frameworks (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.)

* Technology Proficiency
+ Strong experience in backend frameworks and languages (e.g. Java, Go, C#, Node.js)
+ Proficiency with front-end systems (e.g. React, Angular, Vue) and APIs (REST, GraphQL)
+ Good command of infrastructure: containers, orchestration (Kubernetes), cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)

* Integration & Interoperability
+ Experience designing system integration (APIs, messaging, event buses, ESBs)
+ Data modeling, schema design, consistency and replication strategies

* Leadership & Communication
+ Ability to explain and defend architectural decisions to technical and non-technical stakeholders
+ Strong written and verbal English
+ Mentorship, review, and guiding engineering teams to follow architecture

* Process & Governance
+ Experience working in structured environments: change control, audits, documentation standards, governance
+ Ability to enforce architectural discipline and guardrails

* Logistics & Eligibility
+ Based in Europe
+ Able to work under contract legally
+ Willing and able to undergo background / security checks


**Preferred (Not Mandatory)**
* Direct experience on NATO / BQA / defense architecture
* Certifications like TOGAF, CISSP, or other architectural / security credentials
* Familiarity with real-time / embedded systems or network-level architecture


 What We Offer
   

  

* Competitive contract compensation
* Fully remote (Europe)
* Long-term, stable engagement
* Opportunity to architect critical secure systems
* Professional environment with high standards and meaningful work


 Application Instructions
   

  

 To be considered, submit:
   

  

* Your CV / resume, clearly emphasizing architectural roles in security / defense / regulated environments
* A cover letter showing how you meet each mandatory requirement
* Descriptions or diagrams of past architectures youve designed (with rationale and constraints)
* References / contacts able to validate your work in secure / regulated settings


**Important:** 
 Only applications that clearly and explicitly demonstrate you meet
 *all* 
 mandatory criteria will be reviewed. If you cannot prove alignment with each requirement, please do not apply.

title: Integration Architect
description:
**For a Sustainable Future Together**
 Coop is Sweden's largest cooperative and a leading player in the grocery retail sector, with over 4 million members. We focus heavily on sustainability and work to create a greener and more just future by offering sustainable products and services.
   

  

**At Coop, We Live Our Values Every Day**
* Welcoming: We are inclusive, interested, and considerate in our work to create a positive and supportive work environment.
* Inspiring: We are generous and innovative, passionate about always doing our best for our members.
* Brave: We stand up for what we believe in, are transparent, and dare to lead change.
* Responsible: We deliver on our promises and take responsibility for future generations, both in the workplace and in society.


 We believe that a diversity of perspectives and experiences is key to creating a more inclusive and successful workplace. Therefore, we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, age, background, or ethnic origin.
   

  

**Join Coop – Together, we make Sweden's food landscape sustainable!**
**About The Position**
 We are seeking an experienced Integration Architect to join our IT Integration Team, which is responsible for designing, developing, and supporting integration solutions across the entire organization. In this role, you will play a key part in connecting enterprise applications, and ensuring our integration landscape is secure, scalable, and aligned with our business strategy.
   

  

**Your Role And Responsibilities**
* Design and implement integrations between enterprise applications, including ERP platforms such as SAP S/4HANA.
* Collaborate with architects, application owners, and business stakeholders to translate business requirements into effective integration solutions.
* Ensure technical excellence and consistency through peer reviews, automation, and the definition of development standards and guidelines.
* Evaluate emerging technologies, conduct proofs of concept, and recommend improvements to enhance the integration landscape.
* Provide technical leadership, mentoring, and guidance to develop and support teams to ensure timely and high-quality delivery.


***Who are you?***
 You are an experienced Integration Architect with both technical depth and strategic understanding. You have a genuine interest in how technology enables business and thrive in the space between architecture and execution.
   

  

 You enjoy working collaboratively, guiding others, exchanging ideas, and contributing to a culture where expertise is shared openly. You have the confidence to challenge existing solutions and the curiosity to explore new ones.
   

  

**To Succeed In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* Minimum of 10 years of overall IT experience, including at least 5 years focused on Microsoft Azure architecture and integration design.
* Proven expertise in Azure services such as Function Apps, API Management, Event Grid, Storage, App Services, and Entra ID.
* Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines, version control systems (Azure DevOps, GitHub), and agile delivery methodologies.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as C#, PowerShell, or Python.
* Sound understanding of cloud security, networking principles, and performance optimization.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with SAP S/4HANA integrations, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and code quality tools (e.g., SonarQube) is considered an advantage.


 Fluency in both spoken and written English is required, while proficiency in Swedish is a strong plus.
   

  

**What We Offer You**
 We offer you a workplace where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop in an inclusive and inspiring culture. At Coop, you will be part of a dedicated, innovative and skille integration team and contribute to a more sustainable future. We also offer competitive benefits, flexible working hours, and a healthy work–life balance.
   

  

 We work in a hybrid model where you’ll spend around three days per week at our Solna headquarters.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 If you have questions about this assignment, you are welcome to contact Integration Tech Lead Amit Kumar Gupta (amitkumar.gupta@coop.se).
   

  

 We will perform interview continuously so please apply in English with your CV, and some words why you feel you’re a good fit for this role at Coop.

title: Specialist inom Atlassian
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vi söker nu initiativtagande och drivna problemlösare för arbete med design och utveckling av vår IT-miljö. På FRA är varje arbetsuppgift en del av något större. Är du den vi söker kan vi erbjuda ett varierande arbete i en kunskapsintensiv miljö där du får vara med och göra skillnad varje dag.*
 Ditt uppdrag
   

  

 Som specialist inom Atlassian med fokus på konfiguration och utveckling av produktportföljen hör du till ett utvecklarteam inom avdelningen för teknik. Teamet har för uppdrag att utveckla nya verktyg och lösningar i samarbete med användarna. Vi arbetar agilt i sprintar tillsammans med andra team enligt SAFe-ramverket. Vi har också ett naturligt fokus på IT-säkerhet.
   

  

 I Rollen Som Specialist Kommer Dina Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden Att Omfatta Processdesign, Processimplementering, Utveckling Av Atlassians Produkter Samt Förvaltning. Dessa Uppgifter Kommer Huvudsakligen Att Utföras i Form Av
   

  

* Konfiguration av arbetsflöden
* Automatisering och utveckling av gränssnitt till andra produkter i Atlassians portfölj
* Rollhantering och behörighetsstyrning
* Omsättning av beställares behov till tekniska och effektiva lösningar
* Utbildning och utrullning till användare


 Vi erbjuder en innovativ IT-miljö där du får möjlighet att samarbeta med kunniga och erfarna kollegor. På FRA har vi stark sekretess och det är viktigt att du känner dig bekväm med att hantera det.
   

  

 Du kan
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Eftergymnasial utbildning med IT-inriktning alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling och/eller systemadministration
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom systemutveckling och/eller systemadministration
* Erfarenhet av administration, konfigurering och integrering av samarbetsverktyg i Atlassians produktportfölj
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har kunskap och erfarenhet av ett eller flera områden:
   

  

* Agila arbetsmetoder som SAFe eller Scrum
* Erfarenhet av administration, konfigurering och integrering av samarbetsverktyg som exv ServiceNow
* Kunskaper kring digitala verktyg för att visualisera design och process
* Kunskaper i Identity & Access Management (IAM)


 Då teamet ansvarar för produkternas och applikationernas hela livscykel, IT-infrastrukturen inkluderad, ser vi det som meriterande att du har erfarenhet av utvecklingsarbete och administration i
 **Linux** 
 eller
 **Windows** 
 .
   

  

 Du är
   

  

 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är:
   

  

* Initiativtagande – Du tar initiativ, sätter igång aktiviteter och uppnår resultat.
* Samarbetsförmåga – Du arbetar bra med andra människor. Du relaterar dig till dem på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt. Du lyssnar, kommunicerar och löser konflikter på ett konstruktivt sätt.
* Pedagogisk – Du har god förståelse för hur människor tar till sig kunskap och för människors olika förutsättningar. Du anpassar ditt sätt att förmedla kunskap till mottagarens behov och förutsättningar.
* Helhetssyn – Du ser helheter och tar hänsyn till det större perspektivet. Du förstår din roll men ser till hela organisationens bästa i ditt agerande och beslut


 Om FRA
   

  

 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar. Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla känner sig välkomna och trygga. Utöver en stimulerande arbetsmiljö erbjuder vi också ett attraktivt förmånspaket, som du kan läsa mer om på www.fra.se . För mer information om Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter besök www.ncsc.se
   

  

 För din trygghet. För vår demokrati. Varje dag. Året om.
   

  

 Mer information
   

  

 Arbetsplatsen är belägen i närheten av Drottningholm, ca 10 min från Brommaplan. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav då anställning vid FRA innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Ett krav för att få anställning är godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll. Säkerhetsprövningen kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. I denna rekryteringsprocess kommer
 **arbetsprov och tester att tillämpas** 
 . För mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef på nummer
 **010-557 51 99** 
 . Fackliga företrädare nås på 010-557 46 00.
   

  

 Vi tar emot ansökningar via www.fra.se
 **senast 2025-11-09**
 Referensnummer
 **2025FRA1629-10** 
 .
   

  

 Då vi inför denna rekrytering redan tagit ställning till de rekryteringskanaler vi önskar använda undanber vi oss att bli kontaktade för ytterligare erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 





 At Trustly, we're building a smarter, faster, and more secure financial future by revolutionizing the world of payments. As a global leader in Open Banking Payments, we are establishing Pay by Bank as the new standard at checkout, providing unparalleled freedom, speed, and ease to millions of consumers and merchants worldwide.
 




  






 Our Ambition: To build the world’s most disruptive payment network and redefine what the payment experience should feel like.
 




  






 Trustly is a global team of innovators, collaborators, and doers.  If you are driven by a strong sense of purpose and thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and high-growth environment, join us and be part of a team that’s transforming the way the world pays.
 




  





**About the Product & Tech Organisation
 
  






 Our Product & Technology organisation drives the development of Trustly’s products. The cross functional teams collectively work with innovative ideas, development of products and platform and set the vision and strategy for the problem spaces they own. The Product & Tech organisation consists of a bit more than 200 people spread across Stockholm, Lisbon, Örebro, Paris, London and Izmir. 
 




  






 All teams consist of a product manager, an engineering manager, a lead developer and engineers. Some teams also have designers and analytics competence in the team. They all work closely together to enable new products and features within existing products within Europe and to make sure the payment platform runs without interruptions and with high performance.
 




  






 We are now looking to strengthen our engineering capacity within Product & Technology with one more senior position. We operate in an agile culture combined with DevOps, allowing our teams to take on full responsibility from code to on-call.
 




  





**About the Role
 
  






 As an
 
**Engineering Manager
 
 at Trustly, you will play a crucial role in leading and supporting an agile team of talented engineers. Working closely with product managers, lead developers, and other stakeholders, you’ll ensure delivery of high-quality, scalable, and reliable systems while fostering a positive and empowering team culture. This is an excellent opportunity to bridge technical excellence and people management, delivering real impact in the payments industry.
 


  




**What you'll do** 
* **Team Leadership** 
 : Lead, coach, and support a team of engineers, enabling them to perform at their best while fostering a culture of collaboration, ownership, and continuous learning
* **Delivery Excellence** 
 : Drive successful delivery of the team’s commitments, ensuring alignment with domain objectives and product goals
* **Technical Collaboration** 
 : Work hands-on with lead developers and engineers to design, implement, and maintain scalable systems and solutions aligned with Trustly’s technical standards
* **Product Partnership** 
 : Work closely with the product manager to define and prioritise the team’s roadmap, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision
* **Operational Ownership** 
 : Ensure your team’s systems operate reliably in production, with high performance, availability, and maintainability
* **Talent Development** 
 : Recruit, onboard, and mentor engineers, creating an environment where they can grow and thrive
* **Process Improvement** 
 : Advocate for and implement best practices in agile methodologies, DevOps, and engineering processes to continuously improve team effectiveness



  




**Who you are** 
* Proven experience managing engineering teams in agile environments, with a strong focus on team empowerment and delivery
* Hands-on engineering background with expertise in Java and experience in building scalable, robust systems
* Familiarity with modern tech stacks including Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, and Spring Boot
* Experience working with cloud solutions (preferably AWS), monitoring, and analytics
* Knowledge of service-based architecture and microservices
* Strong ability to balance technical decisions with business needs, ensuring delivery without sacrificing scalability, performance, or reliability
* Committed to fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence
* Passion for DevOps practices and ownership, with a track record of driving improvements in automation and monitoring
* Exceptional communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills
* Fluent in English



  




**At Trustly, you’ll have the opportunity to:** 
* Shape the future of payments as part of a global leader in the industry
* Work with cutting-edge technology and highly skilled colleagues in an agile and collaborative environment
* Take on a role with real impact, where your contributions directly drive the success of your team and Trustly’s mission
* Enjoy a supportive and dynamic culture that encourages growth, innovation, and ownership






  




  


**Our Fantastic Benefits**

 (varies by location)
 




 🌴
 **20 to 30 days of holiday** 
 to support a healthy work-life balance
 



 🥳
 **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
 



 👶
 **Parental leave top-up** 
 additional support for new parents
 



 🥐
 **Daily breakfast and on-site perks** 
 to make your workday smoother
 



 💚
 **Well being support** 
 our health allowance covers gym memberships, massages, and much more to help you feel your best
 



**PLUS** 
 additional benefits designed to enhance your work-life experience!
 



  





**Shape Your Role and Make an Impact**




 Join a dynamic environment where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously embrace new challenges. We’re looking for dedicated and highly motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy collaborating across different areas of the organisation.
 



 If your skills and experience align with this role, we’d love to hear from you!
 **Apply now and submit your CV in English.********

title: Senior back-end engineer with GenAI experience
description:
**Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI experience** 




  





**About Arkus AI** 




 Arkus AI is on a mission to revolutionise medicine and healthcare through intelligent, AI-powered technologies. We are developing autonomous AI agents and a robust AI platform to support clinicians, researchers, and healthcare administrators in addressing some of the most complex challenges in medicine
 **.** 




  





**We are looking for a highly motivated and outstanding Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI experience** 
 to help design and develop our AI agent platform. In this role, you will focus primarily on back-end systems and infrastructure while leveraging your understanding of generative AI (LLMs, agent frameworks) to enable cutting-edge healthcare applications.
 



  





**The Role** 




**We’re looking for a highly skilled Senior Back-end Engineer with GenAI expertise** 
 to join our team. In this role, you’ll architect and scale the back-end systems that power our AI agent platform, working at the intersection of distributed systems, cloud infrastructure, and generative AI.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Design, build, and maintain the back-end infrastructure of our AI agent platform
* Develop RESTful APIs, orchestration logic, and integrations with third-party systems
* Work with SQL/NoSQL databases and implement event-driven, real-time architectures
* Collaborate with AI/ML engineers to integrate LLM-based capabilities (open-source and API-driven)
* Ensure security, compliance, scalability, and performance of production systems
* Implement observability, CI/CD pipelines, and containerized deployments (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Write robust unit and integration tests to ensure reliability
* Mentor junior engineers and contribute to technical best practices



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* 6+ years of professional experience in back-end or software engineering
* Strong expertise in Node.js/TypeScript and Python
* Proven experience designing APIs, working with SQL/NoSQL databases, and distributed systems
* Familiarity with LLMs and agent frameworks (LangChain, LangGraph, AutoGPT, Semantic Kernel)
* Hands-on experience with vector databases (FAISS, Pinecone, Weaviate) and retrieval pipelines
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and CI/CD
* Experience with observability tools (Grafana, Prometheus, ELK, etc.)
* Bonus: background in healthcare systems (FHIR, EHRs) or regulated environments (HIPAA/GDPR)
* Strong communicator with architectural vision and mentoring ability



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Shape the future of
 **AI agent platforms in healthcare**
* **Solve complex, real-world back-end challenges at the frontier of AI and system engineering**
* **Be part of a mission-driven, fast-paced team** 
 with direct clinical impact
* Competitive salary, equity options, and flexible hybrid work environment



  





**If you’re passionate about building the infrastructure for AI systems that make a real difference in healthcare, we’d love to hear from you.**

title: Orchestration Software Engineer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Do you want to help shape the future of communication technology? At Ericsson, you will have the opportunity to develop the next generation of tools to support radio systems, including 5G and upcoming 6G, connecting the world in innovative ways. We are looking for a passionate and versatile software developer — either recent graduate or with 1–2 years of experience — who are driven by innovation and technical excellence.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Development: Design and implement solutions for Ericsson R&D, focusing on 5G tools. Primary programming languages include Python, Java, scripting programming languages and front-end development.
* Testing & Quality: Develop features and automated test cases in Java to ensure top product quality.
* Innovation & AI: Explore artificial intelligence opportunities to accelerate development of the 6G Radio Access Network software platform.
* Maintenance & Support: Manage enhancements and bug reports, and contribute to support efforts across different teams, including in high-priority task force situations.
* Continuous Improvement: Participate in system studies and drive ongoing improvements in products and processes.


**The skills you bring:**
* Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or Engineering Physics (B.Sc. or M.Sc.).
* Passion for programming and problem-solving.
* Experience in Java, Python, front and back-end development is a strong asset.
* Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies.
* Interest in open source contributions and proficiency with modern development tools, from AI agents to GIT.
* Knowledge and interest in containers (Kubernetes), integration and testing.
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English.
* Collaborative mindset and experience working in Agile teams.
* Genuine interest in telecommunications and future networks.

title: Enterprise Sales Engineer - Sweden
description:
As an Enterprise Sales Engineer, you will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POVs). Sales Engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners and have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners.
   

  

**What You’ll Do:**
* Partner with the Sales team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers
* Own technical engagement with customers during the trial phase. Communicate Datadog’s value based on activities and work with customers on any identified issues or concerns to successful conclusion
* Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility
* Deliver product and technical briefings / presentations to potential clients
* Maintain accurate notes and feedback in CRM regarding customer input both wins and losses
* Proactively engage and communicate with customers and Datadog business/technical teams regarding product feedback and competitive landscape


**Who You Are:**
* Passionate about educating customers on observability risks that are meaningful to their business, and able to build and execute an evaluation plan with a customer
* Someone with strong written and oral communication skills. This role requires an ability to understand and articulate both the business benefits (value proposition) and technical advantages of our offering
* Hungry to learn new technologies and tools
* Someone with a minimum of 3+ years in a Sales Engineering or DevOps Engineering role
* Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites
* Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 45% of the time


 Bonus points if you have:
   

  

**Experience with Linux** 
**Experience with Python development** 
**Knowledge of Kubernetes & kubectl** 
**Experience with AWS, GCP and/or Azure**
*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

 Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete this form. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.
   

  

**Privacy and AI Guidelines:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice. For information on our AI policy, please visit Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines.

title: AI Performance Engineer
description:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**
 At AMD, our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences—from AI and data centers, to PCs, gaming and embedded systems. Grounded in a culture of innovation and collaboration, we believe real progress comes from bold ideas, human ingenuity and a shared passion to create something extraordinary. When you join AMD, you’ll discover the real differentiator is our culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges—striving for execution excellence, while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives. Join us as we shape the future of AI and beyond.
 **Together, we advance your career.**
**The Role**
 AI Performance Engineers focus on optimizing machine learning models, profiling, bottleneck analysis, and optimal mapping to GPU.
   

  

 As an AI Performance Engineer, you will analyze and explore recent ML models, understand their compute and memory requirements, and optimize them on various compute hardware for both inference and training. In addition you would do profiling and analyzing various workloads on current hardware and coming up with new ways to improve their performance.
   

  

**The Person**
 The ideal candidate will have strong experience with software optimization, GPU programing and hardware architecture. Passionate of getting the best performance out of various hardware’s under different tradeoffs.
   

  

 If you are passionate about performance optimization, getting the best out of the HW, and shaping the future AI performance, then this role is for you.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Benchmark, analyze, and optimize performance of key machine learning applications, on single and multi-GPU systems
* Design, implement, and test GPU kernels and algorithms for tensor operations like matrix multiplication and convolutions used in a variety of high-performance machine learning libraries and frameworks
* Deliver high-quality code and documentation following best practices for open-source software development


**Preferred Experience**
* Understanding of GPU architectures and low-level optimization techniques, memory hierarchy, instruction scheduling, and performance tradeoffs
* Strong background developing applications and libraries in C++, especially high-performance computing and/or scientific software
* GPU software development using HIP, CUDA, or OpenCL
* In-depth knowledge of best-practices in software development, including testing, profiling, debugging, documentation, version control, issue tracking, and planning
* Experience with C++ and Python programming
* Experience in PyTorch, Tensorflow or MXNet
* Experience in high-performance computing (HPC)
* Strong written and spoken English language skills (our company language)


**Academic Credentials**
* BSc, MSc, PhD or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or a related field


*Benefits offered are described:* 
 AMD benefits at a glance
 *.*
*AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Applied EO/AI Engineer (AI/ML + Geospatial Analysis)
description:
**Summary (Role Overview):** 




  





 AquaGuard Technologies is seeking an Applied EO/AI Engineer (AI/ML + Geospatial Analysis) to help develop our Trident GEOINT platform — a dual-use maritime and environmental intelligence system that fuses satellite, aerial and AI analytics.
 



 The platform focuses on automated detection and classification of ADVs (Abandoned, Derelict Vessels) and SUSVs / MUSVs (Small / Medium Uninhabited Surface Vessels), and on identifying maritime anomalies that are hard to detect with conventional systems. These targets can present both environmental and security risks, including smuggling, illegal fishing, espionage, human trafficking, illegal dumping, and the potential weaponisation of uncrewed craft.
 



 Success in this role means building robust ML workflows and data pipelines that improve detection accuracy and provide actionable, responsibly governed situational awareness for environmental agencies and authorised maritime security users.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 




  




* Acquire, preprocess, and analyse multi-source EO data (SAR, optical, and aerial) to support vessel and anomaly detection.
* Design and automate scalable data pipelines for ingestion, transformation, and versioned storage.
* Develop, train, and optimise deep-learning models for detection and classification of ADVs, SUSVs/MUSVs, and related maritime anomalies.
* Implement and monitor evaluation metrics (precision, recall, F1-score, confidence thresholds) to ensure detection reliability.
* Contribute to threat pattern and risk characterisation, differentiating environmental targets (e.g. derelict vessels) from potential security-related anomalies.
* Curate and manage datasets using DVC/GitHub for reproducible ML workflows.
* Integrate models into cloud-based systems (AWS, GCP) for near-real-time processing and inference.
* Collaborate with software and GIS engineers to integrate detection outputs into the Trident GEOINT SaaS platform.
* Prepare concise technical documentation, validation reports, and visualisations for internal reviews and project milestones.







  





**Qualifications & Experience:** 




  




* MSc or PhD in Geoinformatics, Computer Vision, Data Science, or related field.
* Demonstrated programming experience in Python, including libraries such as GDAL, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, and OpenCV.
* Proven experience working with EO data sources (Sentinel-1/2, Maxar, ICEYE, PlanetScope, or similar).
* Familiarity with SAR and optical image analysis, including change detection and anomaly detection methods.
* Knowledge of computer vision and object detection applied to maritime, environmental, or surveillance domains.
* Experience with cloud computing (AWS/GCP) and containerisation (Docker, Kubernetes) preferred.
* Practical understanding of data governance, privacy, and responsible AI in dual-use or sensitive applications.
* Familiarity with data versioning and workflow management tools (DVC, GitHub).
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Self-motivated, curious, and comfortable working independently in a remote, high-impact start-up environment.
* Passionate about leveraging AI and EO to address real-world challenges at the intersection of sustainability and security.
